titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Mrs. Edward H. Webster collection of large format photographic portraits V1991.013
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Patricia Glowinski
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-28T16:15-0500

did.unittitle: Mrs. Edward H. Webster collection of large format photographic portraits

physdesc.extent: three items housed in one oversize box.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Mrs. Edward H. Webster collection of large format photographic portraits, dating from the late 19th century, contains three black-and-white oversize portraits showing Caroline Blackwell (Blossom) Tisdale, William S. Tisdale, and Josephine Mason (Hill) Parker.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Josephine Mason Parker (nee Hill) was the daughter of John J. and Mary M. Hill. She married Frederick Sheldon Parker, a lawyer, on May 16, 1876 in Brooklyn. She died on February 19, 1879. Frederick Sheldon Parker lived at 32 Garden Place in the Brooklyn Heights neighborhood of Brooklyn.

William S. Tisdale (1816-1888) was born in Taunton, MA. In 1843, Tisdale married Caroline Blackwell Blossom (1824-1884) in Brooklyn. She was the daughter of Benjamin and Margaret (nee Blackwell) Blossom. William and Caroline Tisdale had four children and lived on Hicks Street in Brooklyn Heights.
The Blossom and Hill families lived on Hicks Street in Brooklyn Heights. In 1872, Sarah C. Hill (1851-1903) married Frederick Blossom (b. 1830) in Brooklyn.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Mrs. Edward H. Webster collection of large format photographic portraits, V1991.013, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Item level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library. Please consult library staff for more information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for anonymously created items remain in effect for 120 years following the date of creation. Based on the date range of this collection, the photographs have entered the public domain. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. Edward H. Webster, 1958.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Brooklyn Historical Society holds a related collection, the Blossom and Hill family papers (ARC.010). Please consult library staff for more information.
